head.title: Woman Is Raped in Stairwell After Returning From a Party

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Woman Is Raped in Stairwell After Returning From a Party

abstract.p: Police say woman returning home from New Year's Eve party was raped in stairwell of her apartment building near City Hall (M)

block.p: A 21-year-old Manhattan woman returning home from a New Year's Eve party was raped early yesterday in the stairwell of her apartment building near City Hall, the authorities said.

Several hours later, in an apparently unrelated incident, another woman was confronted by a knife-wielding man who forced his way into her car, the police said. But she jumped out of the car, and the man was arrested a few minutes later.
A 21-year-old Manhattan woman returning home from a New Year's Eve party was raped early yesterday in the stairwell of her apartment building near City Hall, the authorities said.

Several hours later, in an apparently unrelated incident, another woman was confronted by a knife-wielding man who forced his way into her car, the police said. But she jumped out of the car, and the man was arrested a few minutes later.
The police do not believe either incident is related to a rape and robbery in Midtown Manhattan in the early hours of Dec. 21, said Lt. Sean M. Crowley, a police spokesman.

In that attack, a 25-year-old employee of WNBC television news who had just left work at 30 Rockefeller Plaza was dragged from the street and assaulted in a stairwell off Avenue of the Americas between West 52nd and West 53rd Streets.

The name of the 21-year-old rape victim was withheld by the police because of the nature of the crime. Officials said she was assaulted about 6 a.m., shortly after she returned home to her apartment building on Murray Street near West Broadway, two blocks from City Hall.
''She was returning home and she got out of a taxicab and he followed her inside,'' said Lieutenant Crowley.
The police described the assailant as a black man between 26 and 27 years old, about five feet 9 inches tall, with a slim build and a slight mustache.
He was neatly dressed, wearing khaki pants and a blue fleece shirt, the police said.

In the incident later in the morning, a woman was parking her car in front of 150 Hudson Street when a man threatened her with a knife and ordered her to slide across the car's seat to the passenger side, the police said.
The man climbed into the car, drove north on Hudson Street and ordered the woman to take off her pants, the police said.
As the man drove past the First Precinct station house, the woman saw officers walking from the building and jumped out of the car, the police said.
The suspect, whom the police identified as Aureo Torres, 41, drove away in the woman's car, but was caught by officers and arrested a few minutes later.
Mr. Torres, of 12 Temple Court on Staten Island, was charged with first-degree attempted rape, second-degree kidnapping, second-degree robbery and weapons possession, the police said.
